text:
We should add a mask_strategy="template" to NiftiMasker that computes the mask by resampling the MNI gray matter tissue to the images, and thresholds it.

The logic behind this (as opposed to the mask_strategy="epi") would be to remove the dependence of the mask on the data at hand (eg in a cross-validation loop) and thus make the computation more cache friendly.

We would have to create a function "compute_grey_matter_mask" in masking.py which take the "target_img" and an optional "threshold" argument as an input and returns the mask.
title: MNI canonical mask in NiftiMasker
